data.current_description: Lists entity rows of a particular entity type contained in the request. Note: 1. Currently, only max of one 'sort_by' column is supported. 2. If no 'sort_by' column is provided, the primary key of the table is used. If zero or more than one primary key is available, we default to the unpaginated list entities logic which only returns the first page. 3. The values of the 'sort_by' columns must uniquely identify an entity row, otherwise undefined behaviors may be observed during pagination. 4. Since transactions are not supported, any updates, inserts or deletes during pagination can lead to stale data being returned or other unexpected behaviors.
data.summary_suggestion: List entity rows with pagination and sorting
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of entity rows for a specified entity type. Supports sorting by a single column (sort_by parameter) and filtering. If no sort column is specified, results are sorted by the entity's primary key. Returns a paginated response containing entity rows. Important: Pagination limitations apply - sort columns must uniquely identify rows, and concurrent modifications during pagination may result in stale or inconsistent data due to lack of transaction support.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description is overly detailed with implementation constraints that should be highlighted as limitations. Reorganized to lead with core functionality, then clearly separate important constraints about sorting, pagination, and data consistency that AI agents must understand before using this operation.

data.current_description: Lists entity rows of a particular entity type contained in the request. Note: 1. Currently, only max of one 'sort_by' column is supported. 2. If no 'sort_by' column is provided, the primary key of the table is used. If zero or more than one primary key is available, we default to the unpaginated list entities logic which only returns the first page. 3. The values of the 'sort_by' columns must uniquely identify an entity row, otherwise undefined behaviors may be observed during pagination. 4. Since transactions are not supported, any updates, inserts or deletes during pagination can lead to stale data being returned or other unexpected behaviors.
data.summary_suggestion: List entity rows with filtering and pagination
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of entity rows of a specified entity type from the external system. Supports sorting by a single column (which must contain unique values for reliable pagination) and standard pagination parameters. Returns a list of Entity objects. Important: Sorting is limited to one column; if not specified, the primary key is used. Transactions are not supported, so concurrent modifications during pagination may result in stale or inconsistent data.

data.current_description: Lists entity rows of a particular entity type contained in the request. Note: 1. Currently, only max of one 'sort_by' column is supported. 2. If no 'sort_by' column is provided, the primary key of the table is used. If zero or more than one primary key is available, we default to the unpaginated list entities logic which only returns the first page. 3. The values of the 'sort_by' columns must uniquely identify an entity row, otherwise undefined behaviors may be observed during pagination. 4. Since transactions are not supported, any updates, inserts or deletes during pagination can lead to stale data being returned or other unexpected behaviors.
data.summary_suggestion: List entity rows with pagination and sorting
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of entity rows for a specified entity type. Supports sorting by a single column (sort_by parameter) and filtering. If no sort column is specified, results are sorted by the entity's primary key. Returns a paginated response containing entity rows. Important: Pagination limitations apply - sort columns must uniquely identify rows, and concurrent modifications during pagination may result in stale or inconsistent data due to lack of transaction support.
data.reasoning: Missing summary. Description is overly detailed with implementation constraints that should be highlighted as limitations. Reorganized to lead with core functionality, then clearly separate important constraints about sorting, pagination, and data consistency that AI agents must understand before using this operation.
